w:r.w:t: How to Create a VPC with Public and Private EC2 Instances on AWS
When launching cloud applications, it's important to organize your infrastructure securely and efficiently. In this blog, I’ll guide you through creating a custom
Before jumping into AWS, let’s define the architecture:

This instance won’t be reachable from the internet directly — which is exactly what we want for private infrastructure.
By the end of this guide, you’ll have:
A public and a private subnet

Two EC2 instances securely placed in the right subnets
